div.p: D53/8429, unit 203, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 856 Colonial Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 10.8.93. To proof.
The Assistant Colonial Secretary, L. Gilles, asked the Auditor General, Childers, to comment on the matter. Childers reported on 31 August 1853: 'There is not provision and in the present state of things, I can hardly recommend to His Excellency to expend money in excess of the estimates'. C. J. La Trobe agreed, 5 September 1853: 'must wait till there be provision'.
'In accordance with a Resolution passed at a meeting of the Committee of the botanic Gardens held at this Office [i.e. Colonial Architect] on the 9th Instant, confirmed at a subsequent meeting held at the Botanic Gardens on the 16th Instant and of which the enclosed is a copy I do myself the Honor to request His Excellency the Lieutenant Governor will be pleased to sanction the employment of six additional men at the Botanic Gardens with wages at the rate of ten shillings per diem.'

'Resolved that it is advisable that the present number of men employed (fifteen) be increased to (twenty one) at the suggestion of the superintendent of the Gardens, confirmed by the opinion of the Government Botanist'.
